title: The EU wants to bind Facebook to its will again – but this time it may have gone too far
text:
I write a lot about how Facebook is like a government. It has a private speech council which draws up rules covering 2.4bn people. It has a police force of 15,000 moderators who enforce those rules across the globe. It has a powerful executive leader in the shape of god-emperor Mark Zuckerberg, and soon it will even have its own "supreme court" to hear appeals.

But every so often, an actual old-school government – one of those "weary giants of flesh and steel", as the internet pioneer John Perry Barlow called them – decides to throw its weight around, and reminds us that multinational internet corporations have not replaced the politicians quite yet.
